title: Decorative "O"
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725123833im_/http:/typophile.com/files/o_5159.jpg)

This O is used as part of a logo, but given the source is not likely original art, rather a decorative font.
author: michellebea

comments.content: If anyone has any idea what font this is, please let me know. Thank you!

I don't recognize this one. If you could accept a substitute Google the words: fonts morris initials, and go to the images tab.  
Don
Thank you Don, I tried, but alas, no luck. Can you tell me the significance of 'morris'?

Late 19th century book designer, type designer and fontographer who revived medieval designs and was a major influence on the style of published books. His fonts are a fusion of Blackletter and Roman. His books used very ornate designs often involving vines and leaves. Your \_O\_ is a comfortable companion to his designs. More [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William\_Morris](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725123833/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Morris "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William\_Morris") There is a lively discussion of his influence at [http://typophile.com/node/114418](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725123833/http:/typophile.com/node/114418 "http://typophile.com/node/114418")  
Don
